Reviews.Title: “Midway but they go all the way!”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great location near the airport.The rooms,the decor, the staff, the beds,the location,the amenities are all as well maintained as you can ask for.Its a solid 3/12 to 4 star and they live up to those expectation.Great grounds,shuttle service,bar hotel and dining and a short walk to many others.Its not near downtown but its all about the location to the airport and its a great place for the money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: cbe0824
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly at this Marriott. The room is comfortable. There is an actual Starbucks attached to the hotel which is a bonus. Ate at the restaurant called Dempseys and had a great meal. Nice place to stay if you need to be near Midway.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kd2muhd
Reviews.Content: Was here to attend a conference. The hotel was super clean with amenities needed for these days when you're limited to what you can pack and take aboard a plane. Excellent breakfast and food at the banquet dinner. The location was very convenient to everything to include Midway airport with free shuttle bus to and from the airport but there is a parking fee if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “A definite gem!”
Reviews.Author: lkmarie
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. The reception and front desk are friendly and excellent with providing directions, making suggestions for eating, and handling all requests. The bed, sheets and pillows were soft and comfortable. The room and the bathroom were nicely decorated and newly updated. I would definitely stay here again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: pickietravlr
Reviews.Content: Never stayed here before and wasn't sure to expect. Very clean, comfortable and friendly, efficient staff

Reviews.Title: “Good price, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: charmtheduck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 miles away from Midway airport. It is in a compound with other Marriot operated hotel chain like the Courtyard and Residence Inn. They have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. The front desk was very nice and helpful. I was given a room with a king size bed in the 3rd floor. The sheets and pillows were soft. The room and the bathroom was nicely decorated. It is very clean and newly updated. There is a fridge, microwave and complimentary drinks in the room. There is free wifi in the hotel lobby. You have to pay $13 for wired internet in your room. They have a business center beside the front desk where you could browse online and print documents. I wasn't able to use the indoor pool and jacuzzi but it looks clean. The fitness room looks adequate and some of the treadmill has a small screen TV in front of it. I ate at the bar/pub located inside the hotel (Dempsey's). It has a good selection of food that I feel is decently priced ($24 for onion soup and chicken and vegetables). There is also a starbuck's coffee house located in the lobby. Friday's restaurant is located across the hotel's parking lot. They also have a hertz rental car desk at the lobby. They charge $13 for parking per day though. I just used the public transportation so I didn't have to pay this. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if staying by Midway”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl13
Reviews.Content: If you're staying near Midway this is a decent hotel. It was clean, there was a mini-fridge in our room, but not in all the rooms, and the front desk people were helpful. The noise from the airport is a little less on the front side of the hotel, but you'll hear sirens from the street. Had breakfast in the restaurant (not the Starbucks) and it was slow, but the staff was friendly. Food was okay. There is no continental breakfast. Parking was $12/day. Shuttle from the airport runs quite often. Would consider staying again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stress-Free”
Reviews.Author: garyandjoadkison
Reviews.Content: We were flying to Seattle and chose to drive into Chicago the day before our flight was leaving from Midway. (Previously we'd always driven to O'Hare and the stress of traffic and parking was horrible). At first I thought we'd have an issue with the light coming through the windows. We usually sleep in a bedroom that is as dark as a batcave. But on my way to the office to complain the neighbor next door told me to look behind the decorative "dummy" drapery panel ....there were vinyl liners so the light wasn't a problem. We also liked the convenience of the shuttle. Be sure to note what colors it is, because when we got back to Midway there were several shutlles picking up people and my hubby almost got us on the wrong one. The driver was extra pleasant. Also, Our car was just fine in their open parking lot for 10 days and so much easier than parking at an airport ever has been! It wasn't cheap, but the room was fine and clean & i would stay again. Nice Dempsey's restaurant right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option!”
Reviews.Author: MarkAW-GRMI
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night on business. Impressed by how quiet a place can be right next to an airport. Very close to mainstreet businesses, and a straight shot from I-294 (south of hotel). Parking lot was undergoing maintenance, so there was a strong smell from the sealant, but didn't permeate indoors. Got a nice Giordanos deep dish pizza while there. Was able to walk to and from.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jal747
Reviews.Content: The room is nicely decorated and the bed is comfy. There is a Starbucks in the lobby with free wi-fi. The hotel is within walking distance (10-15min) to a Wal-Mart and a Target. The only complain is that there is no free wi-fi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Room, airport location”
Reviews.Author: M&M's1
Reviews.Content: Room- this was a standard Marriott hotel. Room was clean. Bathroom was spacious. Location- it was right by Midway Airport. It was in like a parking lot full of other hotels. There was a TGI Fridays in the lot. I didn't see much else within walking distance. My husband ate at the restaurant for breakfast and thought it was average. We stayed here for a wedding due to the location near the reception. If I come to Chicago as a tourist, I would stay downtown versus here.

Reviews.Title: “The reason I choose Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ATL23
Reviews.Content: Excellent and friendly staff made this a welcoming, relaxing overnight stay. Was pleased in the size of the room and that it was perfectly clean and comfortable, as I've come to expect from Marriott. This is one of the better Marriott's I've visited recently, service was far better than the Marriott in downtown Chicago. Concierge lounge was average with an acceptable food and drink variety and welcoming staff. Will return for future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice full-service Marriott, convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: tranman387
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to flying out of Midway airport on Marriott Rewards points. The neighborhood isn't the nicest but it's minutes from the airport and there's convenient free shuttle that runs frequently. The front desk staff was friendly, the hotel was clean and the room wasn't overly spacious but it was nice. The exercise room was excellent with top of the line treadmills and free weights. Being a Marriott Elite Gold member, the only complaint I have is with the concierge lounge. The breakfast hours were really limited (stops at 9:00 or 9:30am on weekdays). I came in a few minutes late to see that everything had already already been cleared minus the orange juice. The attendant was nowhere to be found. When she finally returned I acknowledged being a couple minutes late and politely asked if she could give me a yogurt. She rudely said no because she had already "taken inventory". That was it, no concern whatsoever or advice on where I might be able to buy breakfast. Seriously? This is how you treat your elite customers in a full-service Marriott? I've stayed at entry-level Fairfield Inns where the even the free continental breakfast staff went out of their way to get me food from the kitchen because I came down 5 minutes late. Outside of this highly disappointing interaction with this one particular staff member, the rest of my stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average hotel, with above average price”
Reviews.Author: Jerry-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel online due to one day stopover in area. The hotel was relatively easy to get to from the highway, and was on a very busy street with multiple access points. It is situated in the "Midway Hotel Center", which is 5 hotels situated together with a few restraunts either free standing or in the hotels themselves. There is plenty of parking, as around all of the hotels it is a paved parking lot, with little to no greenspace. The only issue with the parking is that it was mandatory $12 with $1 "parking Tax", wither you are a guest or not. They start towing at midnight according to the desk if you don't have a parking pass. The lobby is decorated like a 1970's velvet lounge, but somehow looking contemporary nonetheless.Staff was very friendly and courteous, and check in was extremely fast and efficient. In the hotel is both a small bar/restraunt and a starbucks. The room was nice and relatively clean, but decorations were very stodgy, the bathroom's wallpaper and decorations were so old it looked like my grandmother's house. the room service menu is very complete, and you can order from the TGI Friday's menu, which is one of the freestanding restraunts inthe complex, which is great if you have kids and want to stay in. The room service menu also has a good selection of wine, also if you have kids. Issues with the room were there was a previous guests moldy food in the fridge, showing me that there was very little cleaning going on as it had been there a while. Also asked the front desk for some coffee packets for the comlimentary coffee machine, and it took two hours for them to arrive. The air conditioning sounded like a hammer on a frying pan every time it shut off, keeping me up all night. The shower was very nice, it had a large shower head and was powerful. The bedroom was large, and there was a lot of room to maneuver. Pay-Per-View movies were $5-$30, so make sure your kids aren't playing with the TV or you may have some unwanted charges on your bill. Gym was small and the other amenities were similar to what you would find at much cheaper hotels. The room charge was exorbanent for what you got, Overall, a very expensive stay for what you get, reccommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “College Tour Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: travelinwithfido
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at this very conveniently located Marriott near Midway Airport (within two miles of airport). We were visiting Chicago to tour colleges. Not the most convenient place to stay to see U Chicago. If you do so, try to avoid side streets in this area and use the major highways. We did not feel 100% safe in the south Chicago area. Hotel seems to be in a fairly safe development of hotels. Maybe folks from Chicago know this - but we did not. A better map from the car rental company would have been a plus. Hotel was clean. Like most large hotels they had a big party going on in the ballroom on the main floor and lots of guests attending this event. Our room was on the third floor in the elevator lobby area. Chime on elevator could be heard in the room - ask for a less noisy room location. Hotel charges for parking, but they waved it for me (perhaps they saw the stress in my face from having just been wandering throughout all the side streets!). They also charge for internet in your room, but lobby area is wireless. Onsite dining and Starbucks. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Family friends have stayed at this located and recommended it to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel near Midway”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: Traveled on business in June and had a great stay. Service was great across the board - front desk, restaurant etc. The hotel was very clean and quiet even near the airport. The Starbucks in the hotel was a great given there is not much in the area for coffee or breakfast. They charged for parking, but the fee was nominal and it was right out front door. I do not like the $14 charge for internet access - not sure how that makes this a hotel good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, with some annoying details”
Reviews.Author: busview
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here. The bed was nice, the pillows extra-nice. The bathroom and amenities were above-average. But ... * Best of luck if you want to sleep in: The curtains do not close to cover the windows. Is this some corporate psychologist/bean-counter way to move people out as early as possible? * $13 a night for Internet is quite a lot. * The flat-screen TV is set with the aspect ratio wrong: All the images are stretched too-wide. * The TV, when you turn it on, shows all kinds of pay options but no way to view plain ol' free television channels. I am a user-interface designer and could not figure out how to watch TV for free at this hotel. We had to call the front desk to figure out how to watch TV for free (just turn it on and flip the channel control up or down, it turns out). It felt like they were trying to trick you into paying money here. * The $12 nightly parking charge is a stout amount, and then the billing for it was confusingly stated. It looked like they had credited our card instead of debited it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place. Definitely will choose it again.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomAndKid
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay near Midway for one night. Made my reservation at a cheap motel and then tried that bidding site. Got this for $8 more than my cheap motel. BOY, am I glad I did! First, the pool is just lovely (if a bit short for lap swims--practicing your flip turns is good). The rooms are comfortable and mine had a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. The toiletries are Bath & Body Works Ginger Citrus; heavenly. I had trouble with the blackout curtains not shutting completely (room is right by the front door & the parking-lot lights), but thankfully had a clip with me. I would have no hesitation staying here again. The service was also very good. I love it when you have nothing to comment on because nothing was there to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewRailman
Reviews.Content: Other than not having free wireless access in room I can't think of any negatives to this hotel. We stayed there one night as members of a tour group that was redirected because of flooding over Amtrak tracks. The restaurant offerings were very good although a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing/comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SeeDworld2
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel and the customer service was just as good. The only down size is we had to pay 12.00 per night for parking!! They don't inform you of that when making the reservation. The breakfast bar is only open from 6:30am-9:30am after that time you have to order from the menu which is very expensive, so we went down to the Ihop not far from the hotel because we sleep in past the cut off time after getting in late from a family gathering. We heard very little noise other than the doors of other rooms slaming it was a very nice Hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile stay unless....”
Reviews.Author: happyhappyhappy2
Reviews.Content: This is a worthwhile stay unless you're really picky. I can only think of a few negatives with this hotel. First, is that there is no free wi-fi. You can, however, access the wi-fi for free in the lobby though. Second, there's no free breakfast. Most of us, however, need to eat less anyway. Finally, I noticed a strange smell permeating through the hotel. It wasn't great, but it wasn't overwhelming either. My spouse, however, did not even notice a smell, so unless you're sensitive to smells, you probably wouldn't notice it either. As for the positives: the first is that the hotel, which is very close to MDW, offers a great park and fly deal for its guests. We got a rate of around $150/night and it included parking for the 9 days we were gone. I doubt we could find a hotel room & parking anywhere in the area for less. If I'm wrong, please email me and tell me so. In this case, however, I don't think I am. They have a shuttle to the airport that starts at 4am (its essentially 24 hours), that is complimentary. We used it to take the train into the city for dinner AND to the airport for our flight. Second, the room and hotel were pleasant enough and clean. Our room included a very comfortable king size bed and a big bathroom with a great shower. We found the hotel staff friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. We didn't use the pool or exercise facility available, but both looked sufficient. We did use the business center, which has computers available for use, including printers to print out your boarding pass. Third, there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel. There is also a restaurant and bar. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel. It's the perfect place to stay when you need a place the night before a flight. It, along with many other hotels, is very close to the airport. While, the hotel isn't in a great area of town (when is an airport in a great area of town), I wouldn't imagine there are many problems with theft. Seemed pretty well lit and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport access”
Reviews.Author: realapprsr
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we have an early morning flight out of MDW airport. We typically travel for leisure and often take weekend trips. We always book the "park and fly" package which allows us to stay overnight before our trip, take the shuttle to the airport the next morning, and take the shuttle from the airport to the hotel after the return flight. We know that our car will be safe in their parking lot, and the convenience is well worth the cost. We had previously stayed in some of the other hotels in this complex, but have been staying at the Marriott since it opened a few years ago because the quality is one step above the others.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I asked for”
Reviews.Author: RKR10
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for a college football game. Once again, I stayed at the Marriott Midway. Clean, friendly, with everything I could ask for. Victoria, a member of the desk staff was very helpful coordinating Chicago entertainment for us as well. Thank you! If your reason for travel is all Chicago loop centered, this may be a bit too far out of town for you. If you are flying in and out of Midway or have things going on in South Chicago, excellent choice. My only complaint is the$13 parking fee charged even though it is just parking in an unsecured open parking lot outside the front door. A bit of bait and switch with the nightly rate. If you want to charge more for a night...just post a $13 higher nightly price. It is a shame to ruin a perfect stay with such a small irritation.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Wolfe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott, near midway Chicago airport, for a long weekend, since most hotels in the down town area were fully booked because of the Chicago marathon. We needed a double room and a room with a crib. Although the foyer is spacious, the rooms are very small. it was impossible to move in the room with the crib, and even the room with two double beds was tiny. Breakfast was good, and was a buffet, which was included in the price we paid. Certainly this is cheaper than most down town hotels, but it is a good 40 minutes drive to downtown or Hyde Park area. This is part of a cluster of hotels all within a few blocks of each other, and the choice depends on the price. it is good for an overnight stay but not really for a prolonged stay for those wanting to visit Chicago. One has to pay for parking although there is plenty of space, the parking lot being huge and shared by other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott quality at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: renma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during our visit to Chicago this summer. It is 20 minutes drive from downtown. We booked two rooms, one for the grandparents, one for ourselves with a baby. The rooms are not big, but the construction, furniture and decoration cut no corners and show the quality of the place, making the stay a very comfortable one. It is also clean and quiet (if windows closed). Staff is friendly. We booked though priceline, two rooms for a price of less than one.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amgobrogge
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when we showed up to this hotel. We were expecting the hotels in this area to be run down since they are all right next to the midway airport, but that wasn't the case. The main lobby is beautiful and comfortable to relax. The rooms were updated and clean. We had drinks at the bar and the appetizers were just ok. Then we had dinner and the service was slow but the food was very good. The next morning the GM was out talking to all the guests inquiring how their stay was. Overall this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: soontobeforty
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline to find a hotel close to Midway airport in Chicago. Got the 3 1/2 star Marriott for a great price on a Saturday night late August while visiting family in Blue Island. The hotel has an impressive lobby and common areas. It is located in an area of several hotels and a TGI Fridays. There were 2 wedding receptions going on while we were there but I never felt they interfered with the daily routines of the hotel . The front desk was quite accommodating with housing ice packs that were needed for recovering surgery. Didn't try the restuarant but did try to get a cup of coffee around 5 and the Starbucks in the lobby was closed. Our room was nice with a huge bathroom and comfortable beds. Fitness center offered several cardio machines and some free weights up to 50lbs. I don't think I'd pay the $159 price on the website (plus $13 parking) but for us it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, super staff, restaurant misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: Earthbound-Traveler
Reviews.Content: This used to be a Holiday Inn Select, not sure why but Marriott purchased the property. Much newer than the Courtyard next door. Great staff very helpful, super clean, great Marriott bed. The restaurant misses, i tused to be decent before, not sure what happened, don't get me wrong it's not terrible, I guess I was just expecting more variety. It's just standard fare.

Reviews.Title: “Unexplained Ghost sighting”
Reviews.Author: Guile_78
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip with my boyfriend. It was roughly 7:30am when I felt a weird presence. I suddenly opened my eyes to find a dark male figure sitting in the desk chair, as I saw the figure in a second the room clock alarm sounded off. My boyfriend opened his eyes to see the male figure then suddenly the chair rolled atleast 4 feet in fast speed. The figure disappeared. I freaked out. The room was located on the first floor. I beleive Room 114, but I am unsure. The room is the last room number located on the first floor directly located at the back entrance. As far as the property and its ammentities, its a beautiful hotel. I loved my stay. I will be back.... Just not that same room.... SCARY!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MegL1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we visited Chicago because we couldn't find any affordable nice hotels downtown on Memorial Day weekend. At first, I was disappointed that we had to stay out at the airport but, in the end it worked out great. They have a free shuttle service which goes to Midway and back (a 5 minute trip) and you can catch the train from there to go downtown (about a 20 minute trip). The one time we did take a cab into town it cost us around $35. This was rather late at night so we didn't have to pay to sit in traffic. The hotel will call a cab service that has a flat rate if you are concerned about that though. The front desk service was very friendly, we always got a smile coming and going. We didn't make use of the restaurants except to order one room service breakfast. The food was nothing out of the ordinary but, the portions were pretty large (not typical of room service in my experience). The hotel has its own restaurant as well as a Starbucks inside and a TGI Friday's across the parking lot (which you can also order from). The pool is average and there is a small fitness facility with a few machines, it's fine for keeping in shape while on vacation. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the bathrooms especially were very spacious. The best part was the price as it was more affordable than similar hotels in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chiefette1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights near the end of June. Free hotel shuttle from Midway is fast and convenient (check with the hotel before you go to find out where you meet the shuttle - I believe it was outside Door 2 on the baggage claim level). The shuttle services all the hotels in the Midway complex. All the hotels pretty much look alike on the outside in that complex. A TGI Fridays is in the center of them and will deliver to your room (I don't believe the hotel has its own room service food however - no menus in the room book for that). Starbucks is attached to the hotel. Dunkin Donuts is across the street. McDonald's is a short distance down the street. I've stayed in Marriotts that felt a bit more upscale, but this one was very clean and certainly above average for an airport hotel. I am a pretty light sleeper and did OK with the night plane noise from Midway. The train is nearby as well and you can hear brakes in the distance. I'd recommend asking to be placed in a room on the front side of the hotel if you think that noise will bother you - the trains and plane noise seemed to be more prominent on the back side. There is a lovely (but small) garden area on the back of the hotel. I have read some of the other comments here about this hotel and I agree with several about the front desk staff who could possibly benefit from additional training. Although perfectly pleasant, they seemed confused about available rooms during my check-in and provided incorrect info to me about the amenities at one point later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: Traveler990
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and extra clean with welcoming decor, a roomy bathroom, and comfy cozy beds. You can't beat the transportation: a free shuttle taking us to and from Midway airport, which offered direct access to the CTA bus and train system. Although we would have preferred free internet access in the room (Motel 6 has it, after all), we were thankful for the business center which allowed us the ability to look up locations and operating hours of the different museums, events, etc. that we wanted to visit. Why did we need to look up locations and operating hours, you ask? Because the employees we encountered were not knowledgeable, nor did they pretend to be interested in answering our questions or even making eye contact. They were incredibly busy with checkins and phone calls, yes, but they lacked a certain courtesy. I have encountered much "busier" employees who also took an interest in helping the customer. I would not recommend this hotel to others, as there are several right in that area which would more than likely offer the same high quality amenities plus a friendly front-desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb business hotel; far from dwntn”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference. I arrived at Midway airport and had to wait a bit for the shuttle (about 40 minutes) but then was quickly transported to the hotel. Upon check-in, I was greeted by a very friendly attendant who was able to give knowledgeable advice on activities, directions, and food. I went to my room and was moderately pleased with the functionality. I liked that the desk had a roll-out second tier in case I needed to spread out. I did not like how cramped I felt. I also did not like that I could clearly hear tv's from rooms on both sides of me. I had a view of the parking lot (not great). But the room itself was tastefully decorated, extremely clean, and richly furnished. The carpet and walls were spotless, the linens and chairs were clean, and the wood was a dark, rich wood. There was a small vestibule near the front door with a coffee maker area and microwave, but it was functionally useless as there was no spare counterspace and it was not near the desk or other counter area. The bathroom had marble and bold maroon colors on the walls. Amenities were from Bath and Body Works and were very nice. There was a tray with an ice bucket and glasses in the bathroom, as well as a useless hairdryer. I made use of the business center, restaurants and meeting rooms during my stay. The business center had three computers with free access and printing, but the printer/copiers were consistently out of paper. The center was very clean, however, and I liked that the computers automatically deleted all of your personal information everytime you exited an internet browser. The restaurant served very good food, but the service was incredibly slow each time. Once I waited to be seated and then had to wait literally 10 minutes before my order was taken. The next time I tried seating myself and waited the same amount of time. However, the food was delicious. There is also a Starbuck's in the lobby and a TGI Friday's onsite. Both the hotel restaurant and TGI Friday's will deliver food to your room, although both delivered cold food. The meeting rooms were also tasteful and served spectacular food. The rooms were large with chandeliers, supplied pads of paper, candy, coffee, etc. No tea, however. Just coffee. Regarding travel into the city, I was told cabfare would be over $35 into the downtown Loop area. I was suggested to take the free shuttle back to the airport and take the train in. The train fare was $2.25 each way, which is clearly much cheaper. While it took a few extra minutes, it was definitely a price-saving option. Luckily Midway is small and easy to navigate. A word of advice, ask the shuttle driver to drop you close to the train entrance. Otherwise, you'll end up in front of baggage claim with a much longer, more confusing walk. One last suggestion: Palermo's is a great Italian restaurant near the hotel. Ask the front desk and they should be able to give you directions. You'll find yourself surrounded by local Italians who worship the food and discover a small piece of little Italy. Amazing food and service. If you just ask the desk for suggestions, though, they probably won't mention it. It's maybe 15 minutes from the hotel, but totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: forkboy24
Reviews.Content: Our room was spotless and we had a great view of downtown. The bed was very nice and comfortable. There is a 24 hour shuttle that will take you to Midway and the CTA station. We really liked having a fridge in the room. We used name your own price on priceline and paid next to nothing for a great room and sevice. Cons: no free wi-fi in the room and you have to pay to park. Overall - would stay here again. Can't really go wrong with a Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient & Surprisingly Lovely”
Reviews.Author: gonicki
Reviews.Content: Booked this one through priceline for the last night of a recent trip for $95 (a jaunt to Indiana to see family book-ended by good times in Chicago). We weren't expecting much, just a convenient location and free shuttle to the airport for our very early a.m. flight. Boy, were we pleasantly surprised! The hotel was beautiful, the staff was great, and the room was fantastic with a very comfortable bed. We could also see downtown Chicago from our room...which promptly inspired us to use the free hotel airport shuttle. We caught a free ride over to Midway, hopped on the orange line into the city (took about a half hour or so), geeked out on the Sears Tower, had a nice cocktail and some appetizers in a very nice downtown hotel lobby (sorry, don't remember which one), and caught the last train back to Midway--where we were promptly picked up again by the free hotel shuttle. Awesome. We couldn't have spent a better last night in Chicago and were totally not expecting to sneak in one last hurrah out on the town! In the morning we got a drama free shuttle back to Midway. I don't know that I would recommend booking a Midway area hotel for a fun trip to Chicago...we actually got our room downtown (Hyatt Regency) for the first two nights we were there cheaper than the Marriott...and riding the train back and forth would probably get old after a day or two...but I can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: traveling4StLouiis
Reviews.Content: As a lover of Marriot hotels, I booked two rooms for a mother/darughter weekend to see The Color Purple. My mom, grandma and cousin arrived that afternoon. They didn't hesitate to call me to rave about how beautiful the hotel was. "Great pick," they said. Later that evening, I flew in to Midway then caught the trolley straight to the hotel. It was the best experience- fast and convenient. There are several restaurants nearby both fast food and dine in. If you're looking for a taste of Chicago Giordano's is down the street and they deliver. Another plus is that to get downtown is a ten minute drive, much closer than O'Hare. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution..”
Reviews.Author: discorick
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed to be the nicest in the area and competitively prices. This hotel isn't terrible but it isn't good either. The lobby smells so bad and odd that the smells could actually be fumes that are bad for your health. The staff pretends to be helpful but never follows up on needs or issues. They asked us for a card but incidentals and claimed it would not be charged. We then found random charges for $75, $95 etc... For every day that we were there. And our rooms were pre-paid using Marriot points! They said they would remove the charges but never actually removed them! Puddles of water were left in the elevator on fake marble floors. The star bucks in the lobby has only left over and stale pastries and the neighborhood is surrounded by check cashing places and liquor stores. Stay away and if you do, please only use a credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: fortheloveofgoodfood
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel could not have been friendlier. We found them exceptional. The hotel restaurant (Dempsey's) had very good food and we would recommend it if you are staying in the hotel. Service was excellent. Our room was well appointed and our bathrooms were a cut above the usual hotel bathrooms. Everything was very clean and the hotel is very well managed with a dedicated and well-trained staff. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “...got my money's worth”
Reviews.Author: trippingJack
Reviews.Content: Flew into Chicago-Midway for the first time. Was spending three nights to tour the City. For someone with NO mobility problems, staying near the Airport works fine. The area around the Marriott has several new hotels - probably all of which are less expensive than the $170/night, single that I spent. But the difference in nightly rate for most is small (less than $30) so decided on the Marriott. All the hotels have access to a shuttle service (every fifteen minutes) to Midway. Once at Midway it is easy to jump on the ORANGE line train that takes you downtown in about twenty minutes. For a two-day pass (unlimited travel) the tarif is $9 purchased in the Midway station. There is a lot of walking if the hotel-airport-train procedure is used - a person with mobility problems might consider staying downtown. The hotel room was modern, comfortable and quiet. Eating in the hotel consists of either room-service, or visiting the in-house restaurant (Dempsey's), or trying the in-house Starbucks. I tried all three and found the food quality (except Starbuck's) to be hit-and-miss. Because of the convenience of the shuttle, and the quality of the room, I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pixie15
Reviews.Content: I recently booked the Marriott Midway at the last minute during the Labor Day weekend. Most of the hotels downtown were sold out (or ridiculously overpriced for the holiday) and I found the Marriott to be reasonable ($159/night). Staff were very courteous and professional, and surprisingly I was upgraded to a full suite. My room had a small kitchenette, fridge, microwave, & a coffee maker. There were lots of cabinets & drawers in the kitchenette, but curiously there were no dishes or cutlery. The room had a huge combo dining/living room area, with a formal dining room table that sits 6. The adjoining king bedroom was spacious, with a separate TV and comfy linens. The bathroom was also very spacious, with a Jacuzzi whirlpool. The toiletries were rather scant, and werenâ€™t replenished the 2nd day of my stay, but that was a small inconvenience. Marriottâ€™s lobby is very large and thereâ€™s an Irish/American restaurant (Dempseyâ€™s) attached. They are currently constructing an adjoining Starbucks. The fitness center was better than most, 3 TVs, lots of cardio equipment, weights and a universal. It overlooked the indoor pool which was a decent size and also had a bubbly whirlpool. While I would have rather been downtown, the location of this Marriot was great (5 mins. from Midway). Thereâ€™s a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport, and the shuttle also goes to the other hotels on the compound (Courtyard, Fairfield, Sleep Inn, etc.). My only complaint about this Marriott was being charged for a $107 phone call I didnâ€™t make, however the front desk staffer graciously took it off my bill. All in all, a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little distance from downtown, a lot of quality”
Reviews.Author: MaggieY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in the middle of August. The price was quite reasonable for an attractive well-maintained hotel. Lobby staff performed their jobs in a really professional manner. Connections, via trolley bus and public-transit train, were great for getting downtown. The hotel is located in an area I affectionately refer to as "the compound", as there were a number of other facilities all grouped together. Free parking is great and the area felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Dream weekend in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: FriendsofStoke
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Chicago for the MLS AllStars vs. Chelsea FC match and had called our travel agent to see where to stay. She suggested Marriott-Midway as it was a nice hotel and close to Toyota Park where the match would be. We were very pleased when we arrived at the hotel. Plenty of parking space, and the room was splendid! Very comfy and cozy, with plump featherbeds, 360+ count sheets and just very very clean. Everything was first class. The staff was terrific, especially their Irish concierge. The loveliest of people to work with and they made our stay one that we will never forget. We will surely stay there again when we are in Chicago for a visit or to see another great soccer match!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker1066
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable and well staffed, and I had no problems at all. If I have to make a flight out of O'hare, I will be staying here again. And the $9/day parking beats the $13/day at O'Hare any day!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Lhg40
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place for my family. The staff was wonderful and the area was secure. This is a new property and we were extremely pleased. Would certainly stay here again.
